intro: Manisuris rottboelliodes, commonly known as the broad-leaved manisuris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
